comments.comment:
My dad was the ACTUAL replacement chef the Gordon Ramsay team hired at this restaurant back when it was still in operation. I still remember meeting Tatiana at that restaurant when I was a kid (after they had filmed and aired the episode of course). It’s honestly surreal seeing Felix do a video on this episode. I’ll ask my dad to see what he remembers and I will share it with you guys. Again, this was years ago lol

(edit/update 1) To clarify further,
my dad was the replacement for the guy who got fired at 
The chef they talked about finding at  ended up being my dad

(edit/update 2) My dad worked at Charlie’s until they eventually closed 8 months or so after they had filmed the episode (financial reasons I think, the restaurant/chef industry is rough believe it or not). During his time there me, my little brother, and my mom went there and we met Tatiana in person, we went there a few times and she would always talk with us whenever she could, at least until my dad was laid off. The last time we EVER interacted with Tatiana was when my parents sold our old couch to her and that was the last I ever heard about her. She was actually rather friendly and polite in person from what I remember. My dad might still be in contact with her, but I am not sure.

(edit/update 3) Thankfully this story has a happy ending, after Charlie's, my dad was able to put his experience there on his resume, which landed him a bunch of other job opportunities. However me and my family eventually grew sick of California, so we moved across the country half a year ago. We now live in New Hampshire, and he's currently working as the executive chef at a super nice seafood restaurant. He loves his job and couldn't ask for anything else :)
I love that she warned Gordon about the lasagna, literally gave "reduce your expectations to zero"
Lmao, her trying to hug the chef with a crying face, immediately after firing him has big Michael Scott energy.

21:36 Get this

An Italian Restaurant, Owned by an American, Who has a Chef that’s Mexican, That managed to cook Chinese Food instead of Italian Food
I love how he goes all in on the owners and chefs but always stays respectful towards the waiters

Gordon has the capacity to absolutely destroy a person with his words

However, as soon as he says “Thankyou, my darling” to the waitress- it is SO endearing
if Marzia allows it, i'd actually love to see her reactions to these italian restaurants on kitchen nightmares

That waitress is amazing. She wasn't even trying to sugarcoat anything. You could tell Tatiana was mad from how much she was badmouthing her and the food. She was so accurate. Deserves not a tip, but a BAG!
My dad was a successful head chef for decades, and one time when I asked him why he didn't want to open his own restaurants he said, and I quote: "because I'm not an idiot.".

I love how consistent and yet so different every episode is:

Inexperienced owners
Family falling apart
Isnt open every day
Isnt happy with the food
Always fighting the customers
"I dont know why its not working."
I love that when the owner tries to gain sympathy, Gordon just drags her back to Earth and tells her he doesn't care and it's her fault.

A real restaurant owner knows EVERYTHING that goes down in their establishment. The fact that this woman has no answers for anything is astonishing. It is said that 2/3rds of restaurants fail in the first couple of years. Even if you put in all of the appropriate effort, it is an absolutely brutal industry. I have so much respect for those restaurants that have stayed open despite the pandemic, massive inflation, and supply chain shortages.
Living for the gossip between Gordon and the waitress during the taste test
As soon as Gordon walks in, every customer suddenly became a food critic
I love Gordon because he’s not yelling at them to be mean or disrespectful he’s doing it to get through to them how awful their doing. It’s crude, but with people who are in such denial they need it.
I feel so bad. As a Mexican I know Casimiro was making Mexican meatballs (Albondigas).  He was making them right. He probably has never made Italian meatballs.
Did she really just say she has the burden of money?!? In front of people that put everything on the line for? She put in like 1000
If you break down in tears over firing someone who is not doing their job and ruining your business, don't open up a business.
Bruh out of context Ramsey sounds hella rude but when you watch these episodes you realise how frikin patient he actually is...

There was an authentic, really delicious French restaurant that opened near me and it went down all because people were mad they didn't serve breakfast, but the owner was a single mother with 3 kids.  Shows that even GOOD restaurants go down if they don't appease customers.

One thing I read one time in the comments and really liked and I always look for it whenever Gordon Ramsay is considered, is how even though he is rough and harsh, he is always polite towards waiters, he knows its not their fault when the dish is bad, and it is something we all could learn from him
Imagine being Marzia and just randomly hearing pewds scream with an Italian accent while you’re trying to read or feed the dogs ️️️

That sweet waitress who took Ramsey's order didn't get treated how she deserves by her co-workers. She was just being up front like you should, and they're telling her to keep her mouth shut.
They didn't deserve her. R.I.P
Hearing her say ‘it’s pink sauce’ and then ‘she doesn’t know what’s in it’ in this beautiful time of 2023 was gold. Foreshadowing

8:35 RIP Genevieve.
For those who dont know the server Genevieve died not long after this episode aired. 
I believe she was in her early 20's and even had a child. She just was honest because she wanted to support her family, and the Owner was getting in the way of her making more money. Once you own a business, it's not just your livelihood on the line anymore, but all your employees.
I love that he calls her on trying to flip it into her being the victim as soon as she gets called out for not knowing a single thing going on in the restaurant.
Felix’s cooking ego is growing throughout this, he may just start an Italian restaurant at this rate
The head chef took full advantage of the main chicks kindness. She grew fond of him and she thought he was doing his best for her. When he was just lazy and was there to collect a check.
Felix becoming the Gordon Ramsay of YouTube seems like a hilarious idea
It turns out Casimiro is now making it as a sushi chef at a Greek restaurant
We need more of this content asap. Pewds x Gordon Ramsay is peak
Sadly the young sous chef, Genevieve, died due to complications from epilepsy not long after the restaurant closed. Honestly a tragic ending. Rest in peace, Genevieve.
I like how Gordon slams the entire staff and Felix still cares about the Pizza- Fork army.
Felix looks so much happier than last few years, kinda glad hes taking YT kinda more chill, its doing him good
Guys I think the problem was the head chef who had absolutely no idea what he was doing. Like homie really thought "fake it 'til you make it".

I love how nice Gordon always is to the waiters. It’s very sweet ️

Side note:
I agree with 16:52 . Italian food is so simple, so good, and so easy to mess up
I like how the owner speaks like she’s in a Disney movie. “I believed in myself so that’s why I did it”.

Sad to learn the server Genevieve died shortly after this aired due to complications associated with Epilepsy. She was so young and seemed like a solid person. I liked her being straight up with Ramsey despite Tatiana mouthing off about her.
putting up your house when you have no experience is actually insane.

I like how he asks if he can speak English and then when he’s told he can’t he tries to use as many adjectives to describe how upset and terrible they are. Very considerate of him. He is trying to make sure he can understand him with his emotions as well. Good job to Ramsey!!!
I would've love to see Felix collabing with Gordan Ramsay
Watching Gordon destroy people both logically and emotionally is always one of the best experiences.
When it comes to cooking Gordon is an absolute expert at roasting literally anyone for the flaws in their approach to it
as the owner and manager she NEEDS to be tasting the food on the regular, this is insane
Swedish man sitting in a japanese apartment is laughing about an american family trying to run an italian resturant and its funny
29:00 The surprise ending kept me waiting to the end and after getting to the end it filled the satisfactory hole in my heart. Thank you, thank you Felix.
I love how the biggest message about cooking was that if you just learn how to cook something and practice it,  it's almost like it's not that hard
Funny how Felix becomes a food critic all of a sudden while at the same time sounding like hes never even cooked noodles before
We need more of this Pewds. We need more nightmares. Urgently.
Who knew that having a good chef is more important than believing in yourself?

8:32 there's actually an episode, where he genuinely liked the food, he cleared his plate off! I forgot the name of the resto but it was located at Brighton and it was a soul food diner in an apartment with 2 floors. He just helped with the menu style/serving-wise and the organization

24:38  she's sad that the abusive guy in her life is leaving, i'd hate to see her romantic relationships.
he said "i knew it" because he knew when Gordon showed up that his easy street pass was going to get torn to shreds, and in this case lit on fire.
Man I've been watching kitchen's nightmare all day long for a few days and now when pewds uploads this it's like heaven to me
The server in the beginning at 8:34 died due to epilepsy related issues. So sad, loved her blunt honesty about the quality. One of the few people being honest from the beginning.
I would've loved Marzia with Pewds reacting to Italian dishes

Walking around with a glass of wine all the time. Of course she was polite and emotional. She was either buzzed up or drunk. And when you look at the gaze of the rest of the workers... That low gaze and wobbling. Tatiana was just buzzed up the whole time
She took the money from her sister and mom, while she, herself, put almost nothing into it, bought the restorant and was like, hey, my job is done.
Love how Pewds strategically watched this whole episode for a video JUST to publicly prove that SOMEONE else eats pizza with fork and knife.  Lmao based pewds
Felix speaking Italian makes me laugh so hard even when his pronunciation is on point
I get the same reaction from my coworker whenever he is criticized for how badly he works. He always retorts back with “you do it.” 22:44

"We seriously have a kitchen nightmare"

Truly one of the moment of all time
I always laugh how their biggest excuse for frozen food is that there is no time ‘what? Too busy with your three customers?’
Pewds looks more and more Swedish as he ages
There was a few episodes where Gordon loved the food so much and it was a genuine case of bad marketing
Felix laughing hysterically when the chef didn't fry the meatballs before adding it in the sauce has me
Watching a Swedish man review a American program where a British man reviews an Italian restaurant owned by Americans..

20:00 I know everyone is poking fun cuz he doesn't know how to cook a meatball. But in Mexico that's how meatballs are cooked. The dish is a soup not a stand alone meat with pasta. Wrong place to make them but its not incorrect - just letting people know :)
it closed on 2012 and the owner is now a actor ,the sweet and honest waiter who addressed Ramsay died of a seizure on 2014
It was so wholesome how the episode ended and then seeing the restaurant was closed was like someone threw me a bucket of cold water, now I feel sad
Imagine being a chef for years and not accidentally learning how to cook.. like that's almost impressive
The way the latin man made the meatballs is a way people in Mexico make them, he probably never made them the way other people would make them.

9:17 "bread's dreadful"
(leaving a note for myself bc I love how he said it)
There was one time Gordon went to a soul food restaurant and loved the food. It just ended up being more of a decor/management issue
Tatiana has to deal with consequences for the first time in her life and the tears don't get her out of it. Feels good man

Pewds : "Whoa, okay calm down..."
Gordon whilst checking the diner's freezer : "Are those meatballs ???" [15:50]
Pewds : (Enraged Viking Noises)
I love how regardless of the shit going on in the restaurant and as bad as the food, and the owner and the whatever, Gordon always has something nice to say to/about the servers
Shrimp in Japan tastes heavenly. The softness and melt in your mouth texture..... Now I'm anxious to taste swedish shrimp if Felix thinks it's better than japanese ones

gets told to make a meatball
Casimiro: makes Mexican dish called albondigas

The chef was actually making albondigas (Mexican meatballs). 
They're typically boiled in a tomato sauce, and sometimes they have a bit of hardboiled egg in the center.

They're pretty good when cooked correctly, but Swedish meatball still the best.
As an Italian myself I’m ABSOLUTELY disgusted by the fact they call it an “Italian restaurant” like Felix said ITS SIMPLE AND EASY! People over complicate something that is so delicious

Gordon ramsay: disgusts
Italians: disgusts

Honestly I'd be down for Felix watching more Kitchen Nightmare videos
So MANY of the episodes are bangers
Everytime Felix does a really loud Italian accent, I picture Marzia's little laugh in the other room
Great reaction Felix! My fav part was 25:34, when they were making the lasagne, looked delicious!

its actually a pretty sad story forgotten in time. a family sacrificed everything for a resturant, it goes to shit but they get help. they get a new chef and they close 10 months later. this quoted from a website:

Server Genevieve from Charlie's Italian Bistro sadly passed away from complications due to epilepsy.

Charlie's Italian Bistro was aired on February 17 2012, the episode was filmed in October 2011 and is Kitchen Nightmares season 5 episode 12.
I love when Gordon is going on a rant and pewds is just like "YEEES OMG" "WOWW" like he's so into it it's so funny
Wild that I started watching pewdiepie 10 years ago, great to see he’s still doing well
These people really just need to tell their staff, just do whatever Ramsey tells you to do. These managers don’t seem to understand how successful of a chef Ramsey is

90% of Kitchen Nightmares episodes can be boiled down to “spoiled owner with a wealthy family wants to own a restaurant but doesn’t want to put in the work, hires bad staff and treats it like a personal playground”

To be fair, i sympathize with the head chef a bit. He's kinda old and he’s done everything this way his entire life, and then suddenly someone walks in and criticizes every single thing he does (although said criticizm was valid), I mean, it’s kind of impossible not to feel hurt or get defensive. He never raised his voice either.
I love seeing Gordon Ramsay being a positive force and restoring the restaurant. He's really good at destroying people, but he's also good at building them up.

I get the precooked pasta and storing it, when I worked at olive garden last year we did something similar. It gets made in batches in a gaint machine that looks like a deep fryer but boils water. It then gets stored on a speed rack and is wrapped and labeled, as needed it gets pulled from the walk in and gets put under the line in a refrigerated section. Each serving is then pulled and put into a small cylinder dipping basket and put into the water to reheat for anywhere from 5 seconds for angel hair and 10 seconds for other pasta's.
actually this is a great idea 7:30 i would love to see pewds go to small creators of yt & roast them like this , i would watch that all day actually
If their is a “ channel nightmare” I’m sure pewdiepie will be in the role of Gordon Ramsey
I love that he asks Marzia to confirm the answer and knowing he was right all along
You need to do more of these man, really good video!!
During college, all I’d watch was Pewdiepie and Kitchen Nightmares! It’s great to finally see a crossover!
Guys I'm SO glad I stuck around for the surprise at the very end, I promise it's worth it!
I love how he's criticizing everything, and I'm out here just living with my frozen dinner having a good time while watching this video
25:40 that "lets see, good, take your time" fits in so well
"Owning a restaurant is like owning an elephant. Eventually it's going to shit on your head." - Gordon Ramsay

What's sad and funny at the same time is how Gordan comes in and insults the crap out of the restaurants

"How can you be an Italian restaurant owner and call pasta 'noodles', that's illegal" - Felix
Couldn't agree more.
Wait till Pewds sees that Amy's baking company episode. Absolute gem

For someone to successfully run a restaurant you have to know each part of the business. How to order the product, the cooking, the menu. The overhead. Everything. You can just hope your head cook will care enough to make sure you are making money
i love how pewds was cracking on seeing those chefs fail a meatball task
9:57 his laughter is adorable

I kinda wanna see Felix reacting to places that Gordon genuinely liked ngl

Hi there, I'm half Mexican and the think with casamiro and the meatballs is that the word for meatball in Spanish is albondiga. There's also a dish in Mexico called albondigas. So when she told him Gordon wants him to make meatballs(albondigas) he made the dish which is a soup with meatballs.
the guy is making albondigas, they are mexican meatballs that are boiled in soup

everytime pewds posts a video my day gets better. honestly, even if he just reacts to videos, his reactions and humour is so funny and entertaining.
This is my favorite evolution of Pewds! I loove watching these type of videos and the vlogs. I'm in my 30s and the vibe, humor and just overall feel of the videos is exactly right haha
The US one is way more dramatic and addictive than the UK version for me. And please have Marzia commenting on Italian families getting into restaurant business

"Get close to it" wasn't for you dude, but I'll allow it.
I appreciate daniella's honesty and of course Tatiana's just like "nah she's talking shit" no no she's giving valid criticism
